p: Analgesic activity success was obtained by reducing lactonic function of the marrubiin, in the formation of marrubiinic acid and two esterified derivatives, which have shown significant analgesic effect on the writhing test in mice [ 68, 374]. The pharmacological studies specified that marrubiinic acid presents an important ( p < 0.05) and dose-dependent antinociceptive effect, against the writhing test, in intraperitoneal administration, with ID50 value of 12 μmol/kg, being about 11-fold more active than the standard drugs used as reference, but less active than marrubiin [ 64].
